analyzed: jātaka  pañcaka nipāta  maṇi kuṇḍala vagga
translated: Birth Stories🔽The Fives🔽The Chapter with Short Stories
The Ghaṭa Birth Story
Others grieve and weep,
others are people with tearful faces;
You have a clear face and complexion,
why do you not grieve, Ghaṭa?
Grief does not take away what is past,
nor does it bring future happiness;
Therefore, Ghaṭa, I do not grieve,
there is no second chance in grief.
One who grieves becomes pale and wasted,
and food does not appeal to him;
Enemies are happy,
when he is struck down by an arrow.
Whether in the village or the forest,
whether in the low ground or the high;
Standing, it will not miss me,
thus I have seen the footprint.

analyzed: yaḥ sattā na alam ekaḥ iva
translated: For him who has that, it is not fitting,
the bringer of all sensual pleasures;
Even the whole earth for him,
will not bring happiness.”
The Ghaṭa Birth Story is the fifth.
